alert.note: Alert for Buncombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 1:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Buncombe County through 215 PM EDT... At 138 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Downtown Asheville, or 4 miles southwest of Leicester, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downtown Asheville, East Asheville, West Asheville, North Asheville, Woodfin, Weaverville, Biltmore Forest, Bent Creek, Leicester and B.R. Parkway-Nc Arboretum To East Asheville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
